text: Which factors are most important to you when choosing a destination country?
helpText: Select up to 3 factors that are most important in your decision-making process.

text: What type of location would you prefer to live in?
helpText: Your location preference may affect your immigration options, as some programs are specific to rural or regional areas.

text: What climate do you prefer?
helpText: Climate preferences may help narrow down regions within your destination country.

options.label: Seasonal with distinct summers and winters

text: How important is proximity to your home country?
helpText: Consider factors like travel time and cost for visits home.

text: How important is having a community from your home country in your destination?
helpText: Some immigrants prefer areas with established communities from their home country to ease cultural transition.

text: What is your preferred timeline for obtaining permanent residence?
helpText: Different immigration pathways have different processing times and requirements for permanent residence.

text: How important is the ability to sponsor family members in the future?
helpText: Different countries have different policies regarding family sponsorship after you become a permanent resident.

text: Which family members would you like to sponsor in the future?
helpText: Different countries have different policies on which family members can be sponsored.

text: How important is access to public healthcare in your destination country?
helpText: Healthcare systems vary by country, with some offering universal public healthcare and others relying more on private insurance.

text: How important is access to free or affordable education in your destination country?
helpText: Education systems and costs vary by country, with some offering free or subsidized education and others having significant tuition fees.

text: How important is the cost of living in your destination country?
helpText: Cost of living includes housing, food, transportation, healthcare, education, and other daily expenses.

text: What is your preferred cost of living level?
helpText: Different regions within countries can have vastly different costs of living.

options.label: Low cost of living (may be in smaller cities or rural areas)
High cost of living (typically in major cities with more opportunities)

text: How important is political stability in your destination country?
helpText: Political stability can affect long-term security, economic opportunities, and quality of life.

text: How important is freedom of religion, expression, and personal rights in your destination country?
helpText: Countries vary in their protection of civil liberties and personal freedoms.

text: How important is environmental quality and access to nature in your destination country?
helpText: Consider factors like air quality, access to parks and natural areas, and environmental policies.

text: How important is public transportation in your destination?
helpText: Some locations have extensive public transportation systems, while others may require car ownership.

text: How important is cultural diversity in your destination?
helpText: Some locations have more diverse populations and multicultural environments than others.

text: Are you open to learning a new language if required?
helpText: Some countries require language proficiency for immigration or integration.

options.label: Yes, I'm willing to learn a new language
Somewhat, but I prefer countries where I can speak my language
No, I prefer to immigrate where I can speak my language

text: How important is the tax system in your destination country?
helpText: Tax systems vary widely, with some countries having higher tax rates but more public services, and others having lower taxes but fewer services.

text: What type of tax system do you prefer?
helpText: Different countries have different approaches to taxation.

options.label: Lower taxes with fewer public services
Balanced approach with moderate taxes and services
Higher taxes with comprehensive public services
